dialog.label: Test for the variance of one population

wizard.label: Test for the variance of one population

text.p: This procedure performs the variance test for detecting a significant difference between the variance of one population and a given value, and estimating the variance with a confidence interval.
Insert the numeric variable to test.

If you want different tests for the categories of one or several factors, check the box Test by groups and select the factors to define the groups. If you select more than one factor you will get one test for every category combination of the factors.
Enter the value of the variance in the null hypothesis
Select the type of alternative hypothesis to test:

ul.li: Check two-sided you have no assumption about what variance is greater.
Check greater if you assume that the variance of the population is greater than the vale set in the null hypothesis.
Check less if you assume that the variance of the population is less than the value set in the null hypothesis.

text.p: The one-sided hypothesis tends to increase the power of the test.
If you wants a confidence interval to estimate the variance of the population check the box and enter the desired confidence level (a 95% of confidence correspond to a 5% of significance).
